name: roxmltree

readme.raw_markdown:
[](https://docs.rs/roxmltree/latest/roxmltree/all.html "show sidebar")
# Crate roxmltreeCopy item path
[Settings](https://docs.rs/roxmltree/latest/settings.html)
[Help](https://docs.rs/roxmltree/latest/help.html)
Summary[Source](https://docs.rs/roxmltree/latest/src/roxmltree/lib.rs.html#1-1746)
Expand description
Represent an [XML](https://www.w3.org/TR/xml/) document as a read-only tree.
The root point of the documentations is [`Document::parse`](https://docs.rs/roxmltree/latest/roxmltree/struct.Document.html#method.parse).
You can find more details in the [README](https://github.com/RazrFalcon/roxmltree/blob/master/README.md) and the [parsing doc](https://github.com/RazrFalcon/roxmltree/blob/master/docs/parsing.md).
The tree structure itself is a heavily modified <https://github.com/causal-agent/ego-tree> License: ISC.
## Structs[§](https://docs.rs/roxmltree/latest/roxmltree/#structs)

[Attribute](https://docs.rs/roxmltree/latest/roxmltree/struct.Attribute.html "struct roxmltree::Attribute")
    An attribute.

[Attributes](https://docs.rs/roxmltree/latest/roxmltree/struct.Attributes.html "struct roxmltree::Attributes")
    Iterator over a node’s attributes

[AxisIter](https://docs.rs/roxmltree/latest/roxmltree/struct.AxisIter.html "struct roxmltree::AxisIter")
    Iterator over specified axis.

[Children](https://docs.rs/roxmltree/latest/roxmltree/struct.Children.html "struct roxmltree::Children")
    Iterator over children.

[Descendants](https://docs.rs/roxmltree/latest/roxmltree/struct.Descendants.html "struct roxmltree::Descendants")
    Iterator over a node and its descendants.

[Document](https://docs.rs/roxmltree/latest/roxmltree/struct.Document.html "struct roxmltree::Document")
    An XML tree container.

[ExpandedName](https://docs.rs/roxmltree/latest/roxmltree/struct.ExpandedName.html "struct roxmltree::ExpandedName")
    An expanded name.

[Namespace](https://docs.rs/roxmltree/latest/roxmltree/struct.Namespace.html "struct roxmltree::Namespace")
    A namespace.

[NamespaceIter](https://docs.rs/roxmltree/latest/roxmltree/struct.NamespaceIter.html "struct roxmltree::NamespaceIter")
    Iterator over the namespaces attached to a node.

[Node](https://docs.rs/roxmltree/latest/roxmltree/struct.Node.html "struct roxmltree::Node")
    A node in a document.

[NodeId](https://docs.rs/roxmltree/latest/roxmltree/struct.NodeId.html "struct roxmltree::NodeId")
    A node ID stored as `u32`.

[PI](https://docs.rs/roxmltree/latest/roxmltree/struct.PI.html "struct roxmltree::PI")
    A processing instruction.

[ParsingOptions](https://docs.rs/roxmltree/latest/roxmltree/struct.ParsingOptions.html "struct roxmltree::ParsingOptions")
    Parsing options.

[TextPos](https://docs.rs/roxmltree/latest/roxmltree/struct.TextPos.html "struct roxmltree::TextPos")
    Position in text.
## Enums[§](https://docs.rs/roxmltree/latest/roxmltree/#enums)

[Error](https://docs.rs/roxmltree/latest/roxmltree/enum.Error.html "enum roxmltree::Error")
    A list of all possible errors.

[NodeType](https://docs.rs/roxmltree/latest/roxmltree/enum.NodeType.html "enum roxmltree::NodeType")
    A list of supported node types.

[StringStorage](https://docs.rs/roxmltree/latest/roxmltree/enum.StringStorage.html "enum roxmltree::StringStorage")
    A string storage.
## Constants[§](https://docs.rs/roxmltree/latest/roxmltree/#constants)

[NS_XMLNS_URI](https://docs.rs/roxmltree/latest/roxmltree/constant.NS_XMLNS_URI.html "constant roxmltree::NS_XMLNS_URI")
    The <http://www.w3.org/2000/xmlns/> URI.

[NS_XML_URI](https://docs.rs/roxmltree/latest/roxmltree/constant.NS_XML_URI.html "constant roxmltree::NS_XML_URI")
    The <http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace> URI.

readme_summary: The `roxmltree` crate represents XML documents as read-only trees, enabling efficient parsing and traversal. It provides a robust API with features like iterators for attributes, children, descendants, and namespaces, as well as support for node types, expanded names, and namespaces. The crate is lightweight, leveraging a modified `ego-tree` structure, and includes error handling and customizable parsing options.
factual_counterfactual:
### Pair 1: Parsing XML Documents  
✅ **Factual:** The `roxmltree` crate provides a `Document::parse` method that allows users to parse XML documents into a read-only tree structure for efficient traversal.  
❌ **Counterfactual:** The `roxmltree` crate supports direct modification of the XML tree structure, enabling users to add or remove nodes dynamically after parsing.  

---

### Pair 2: Namespace Handling  
✅ **Factual:** The `roxmltree` crate includes support for XML namespaces, allowing developers to query and iterate over namespaces attached to nodes using the `NamespaceIter` struct.  
❌ **Counterfactual:** The `roxmltree` crate does not support XML namespaces, requiring developers to handle namespace resolution manually.  

---

### Pair 3: Error Handling  
✅ **Factual:** The `roxmltree` crate defines an `Error` enum that lists all possible parsing errors, such as malformed XML or unsupported features, making it easier to handle edge cases during XML parsing.  
❌ **Counterfactual:** The `roxmltree` crate does not provide detailed error handling and will silently ignore malformed XML documents without reporting issues.
